meanings.definition: A statement of an intention to inflict pain, injury, damage, or other hostile action on someone in retribution for something done or not done.
meanings.sent1: The bully made threats to scare the other kids.
meanings.sent2: The police took the threats seriously and investigated the matter.
meanings.sent3: The cat made threats to the mouse, but they were just playing.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds made threats with thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's threats of detention kept the students in line.

meanings.definition: A person or thing likely to cause damage or danger.
meanings.sent1: The wild bear in the forest is a real threats to campers.
meanings.sent2: The cybersecurity threats are constantly evolving in today's digital world.
meanings.sent3: The broken bridge was a threats to the travelers, but they found another way.
meanings.sent4: The dragon in the story was a metaphorical threats to the kingdom's peace.
meanings.sent5: The looming dark clouds were a visible threats of an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: A statement of an intention to take punitive action against someone.
meanings.sent1: The boss's threats of firing motivated the employees to work harder.
meanings.sent2: The threats of legal action made the person reconsider their actions.
meanings.sent3: The threats of a time-out were enough to make the child behave.
meanings.sent4: The threats of a strike by the workers put pressure on the company to negotiate.
meanings.sent5: The threats of a penalty kick made the goalkeeper nervous.
